column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Write a Risk Management Policy

#Text=A risk management policy serves two main purposes : to identify , reduce and prevent undesirable incidents or outcomes and to review past incidents and implement changes to prevent or reduce future incidents .

#Text=For example , a doctor 's office may utilize their risk management policy in order to continuously analyze and improve upon their policies and practices that affect the rate of patients re-admitted due to hospital-borne infections .
#Text=Knowing how to write a risk management policy is a central part of an organization or business 's strategic planning and growth .
#Text=Follow these steps and learn how to write a risk management policy .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Identify the potential risks involved in the context of your work and for all the stakeholders .
#Text=Consider the context of your work within the different transactions or processes .

#Text=Include long-term strategic objectives and decisions , operational or day-to-day activities , financial management and controls , intellectual and information technology actions and knowledge , and compliance/regulatory issues and policy decisions .
#Text=Write down all the things that could potentially go wrong and how that might happen .
#Text=Divide this information into sections to address each individually .
#Text=Analyze all the potential risks that you have identified .
#Text=Write down how they may occur and potential methods of prevention , additional steps that could be taken to prevent them , and how those risks are evaluated and assessed regularly .
#Text=Assess all the past incidences that your organization has encountered and how these occurrences were handled .
#Text=Consult past records to determine how frequently incidents have happened , and how they were handled , including processes that worked and those where there were areas of improvement .
#Text=Estimate the likelihood of each risk re-occurring based on the history of your organization , best practices , and peer experiences .
#Text=Develop a treatment plan for all of the risks that you have identified , prioritizing the risks that you have found will be more likely to occur .
#Text=Be sure to outline a step-by-step expectation for how each risk will be avoided , how it will be handled if it does occur , and how it will be recorded .
#Text=Calculate and include a cost estimation for the steps needed to align with the risk management policy recommendations .
#Text=Provide this information to the internal audience when the policy is proposed .
#Text=Prepare a report for both internal and external stakeholders , sharing what auditing steps are in place to revisit and evaluate the policy .
#Text=The internal and external audiences need different information ; internal audiences need to know the greatest risks , who is accountable for what , and how the process will be monitored .
#Text=External audiences need to know risk management is a part of the organization 's culture and how the process and policy has been laid out .
#Text=Create a data tracking system to input all statistics on risk management successes and failures , training staff to use it .
#Text=Creating a risk assessment form for use after an incident can be a useful tool to examine whether more precautions should have been taken .
#Text=This allows all the data to be recorded right after the occurrence , and for the same information to be gathered each time .
#Text=Set up a regular monitoring process to review all risks and evaluate how the treatment plan has been working .
#Text=Revisit the risk management policy every 6 months to evaluate its effectiveness by comparing incident occurrence rates .
#Text=Revise the plan as necessary .
#Text=Risk management planning and evaluation should be a continuous , evolving process that integrates seamlessly into a company or organization 's culture .
#Text=Video
#Text=Tips
#Text=Be sure to identify a key department or person who is responsible for assessing and monitoring each risk that has been identified to increase accountability .
#Text=Be sure that all of your plans to avoid risks maintain compliance with the law and whatever regulating agencies apply to your field of work .
#Text=All staff should be involved in creating the risk management plan .
#Text=Front-line workers may have a better sense of the range of risks than higher-level managers .
#Text=However , some organizations designate one person to be a risk management officer that is the lead on risk management policies and evaluation .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Be sure to utilize the writing process as a collaborative effort and do not allow it to be a blaming or finger-pointing session .
#Text=Be sure to outline from the start that it is a positive , preventative process and not a punitive one stemming from how something in the past was handled .
#Text=After identifying risks within the organization , revisit insurance coverage amounts .
#Text=Discuss with others involved with the risk management policy process and adjust coverage accordingly , if deemed necessary .
#Text=Identifying risks and hazards shifts some responsibility to managers .
#Text=After identifying risks , managers must then be willing to provide trainings , equipment , and oversight to equip staff with the ways and means to avoid those risks .
